channel.title: Starting up the server doesn't work?
channel.description:
I downloaded Quantum economy, this is the first server downloaded on my new computer and it doesn't work i didn't know if it was something with the code or my computer so please help here's some screenies: This is the code and error- [URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/266/wontstart.png/][IMG]http://img266.imageshack.us/img266/6003/wontstart.png[/img][/URL]
this is my c:/ drive at the java directory [URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/705/wontstartc.png/][IMG]http://img705.imageshack.us/img705/9118/wontstartc.png[/img][/URL]
if you need to see anything else just ask Any help is appreciated

item.title: Starting up the server doesn't work?
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

Try

@echo off title Server[Economy] 639 "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\Jdk1.7.0_04\bin\java.exe" -Client -Xmx512m -cp bin;lib/* org.dementhium.RS2ServerBootstrap pause

If that doesn’t work try this one

@echo off title Server[Economy] 639 "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\Jdk1.7.0_04\bin\java.exe" -Xmx512m -cp bin;lib/* org.dementhium.RS2ServerBootstrap pause

Read full topic
item.source: Starting up the server doesn't work?

item.title: Starting up the server doesn't work?
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

No, I didn’t mean that, just add START at the front of the line, but like I said it probably won’t make a difference.

Put the JDK in “Program Files”

Read full topic

item.title: Starting up the server doesn't work?
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

START java -client -Xmx512m

edit, that probably won’t make a difference.

Trying installing the jdk java to “Program Files” instead of “Program Files(x86)”
